intro: Cyperus aridicola, commonly known as the desert flatsedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of wax, reducing water loss. Cyperus aridicola plays a role in stabilizing soils in degraded landscapes and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
